ngiemboon: Yěsô la ná mɔɔn mentÿɔgɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, éfó Ngalílîa ńkẅɛ, ńdɔg shÿó Jẅindê ńgʉa na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ.
en: When Jesus had finished saying these things,   he departed from Galilee and went to the region of Judea across the Jordan.  # 19:1 Mt 7:28; Lk 9:51; Jn 10:40

ngiemboon: Aláʼ cʉ́me nzèm yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Á kúu wó, ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ nùɔ pɔ́b zeŋe.
en: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a na nùɔ pafalísáyè tó yɔ́b, ńkwaʼte Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Tà áa péʼe lepʉ̌ ségè zẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ jwoŋo nzwě we tà mbɔɔ na yɛ̌ nò wɔ́ɔ gie à fʉ̌a?»
en: Some Pharisees approached him to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife on any grounds? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi te tóŋo mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé, ńjúʼ wɔ́ ka? Mé la ŋweʼe ngie: “E Ssé la fó nùŋe ngwòŋ, ḿbwóon mámbàŋa pɔ́ manzwě,”
en: “Haven’t you read,” he replied, “that he who created    them in the beginning made them male and female,   # 19:4 Gn 2:18; Mt 21:16,# 19:4 Gn 1:27; 5:2

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: “Nyìŋ mbàŋa ge láʼ fag nnɛ́ ye na tá we pɔ́ má we, é gʉa la nnɛ́ na nzwě we, pɔ́ yé temte ńcʉ́ʼʉ tàʼ nyìŋ.”
en: and he also said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?   ,# 19:5 Gn 2:24

ngiemboon: Á fó na fʉʼó pɔ́ té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a wɔ́, pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tàʼ nyìŋ. Púʼu la, nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ɔn léfege mmó gie Ssé temté.»
en: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore, what God has joined together, let no one separate.”

ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè zɛ́te yé ngie: «Tà mélàʼakɔ́, Mǒonsê la gɔɔn ngie mé náa ŋwàʼne á mbwó manzwě lélɔg ńjwoŋo yé.»
en: “Why then,” they asked him, “did Moses command us to give divorce papers   and to send her away? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Mǒonsê lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn púʼu, mélàʼmie à la gyá ngie pi tʉʉ twó mbwó Ssé tà á cʉa. Tá á zẅíŋ ngie pi jwoŋ mezwě pí, mbà á la fó nùŋe ngwòŋ, ńké te púʼu wɔ́.
en: He told them, “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because of the hardness of your hearts, but it was not like that from the beginning.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjwoŋo nzwě we té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie à gÿǒ gÿɛ́, ńzɔ́ʼɔ tsɔ̌, mbà ngàŋ gÿo pɔ́ gÿɛ́.»
en: I tell you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another commits adultery.”   ,# 19:9 Mt 5:32; Lk 16:18

ngiemboon: Engàŋakwò Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «À lɔ́ɔnndá lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pɛ́ʼɛ̀, mbà mvfò aa nyìŋ lénéŋe té zɔ́ʼ.»
en: His disciples   said to him, “If the relationship of a man with his wife is like this, it’s better not to marry.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Epʉ̀a metsèm zɔ̌ té kuʼu lézẅíŋe yɔɔn nò wɔ́. Táʼ, e Ssé kě ne ńgÿo, etsɔ́ ntáʼ pʉ̀a kuʼu mǒ.
en: He responded, “Not everyone can accept this saying, but only those to whom it has been given.

ngiemboon: Eshúm sie é gÿo pʉ̀a té zɔ́ʼ, é gwɔ́ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn: Á gʉa na tsɔ́ pʉ̀a, pɔ́ té kuʼu lézɔ́ʼ wɔ́, tà fó pɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzyé; ńgʉa na petsɔ́, mbà pʉ̀a mesoŋ zɔ̌ la gÿo; ḿbiŋ ńgʉa na petsɔ́, mbà pɔ́ la zẅíŋe légwɔ́ púʼu, ntí nò lefùɔ Ssé. Nyìŋ gẅie à gyǎ lézẅíŋe yɔɔn nò, à zẅíŋ.»
en: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb, there are eunuchs who were made by men, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves that way because of the kingdom of heaven. The one who is able to accept it should accept it.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gÿo ńne ńdɔgɔ gubé, ńtóo mvfò Yěsô légwɔ́ gie à ge gwɔ́ záb mbwó na pɔ́b, é ne sẅíŋte Ssé. Táʼ, engàŋakwò yé ne ńtɔʼɔ wɔ́b.
en: Then little children were brought to Jesus for him to place his hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: «Pi nyé gubé pɔ́ tó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ́ɔn, tà pi táte wɔ́b, epʉ̀a pie ée páʼ gubé, zɔ̌ gẅiin nò na lefùɔ Ssé.»
en: Jesus said, “Leave the little children alone, and don’t try to keep them from coming to me, because the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”   ,# 19:14 Mt 18:3; 1Pt 2:2

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńzáb mbwó na pɔ́b, afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, á fó jʉʼó ńgʉa.
en: After placing his hands on them, he went on from there.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gÿo ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Tsítsà, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, n gÿo kɔ́ nò mbòŋo tà ńgẅiin legwɔ́ temì?»
en: Just then someone came up and asked him,   “Teacher, what good must I do to have eternal life? ”  # 19:16 Mk 10:17; Jn 12:25; Ac 13:48

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: «Mélàʼakɔ́ ɔ̀ zɛ́te wɔ́ɔn nò na mmó gie áa mbòŋ? Nyìŋ mbòŋo gwɔ́ pɔ́ wémɔʼɔ́. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi Ssé e gwɔ́, ɔ̀ kúʼte mbʉ̌ mé.»
en: “Why do you ask me about what is good? ”    he said to him. “There is only one who is good.   # 19:17 Other mss read “No one is good but one #— #God If you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”   # 19:17 Lv 18:5; Neh 9:29; Ezk 20:21

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te ngie: «É mɛ̌ mbʉ̌?» Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Te zẅé nyìŋ, te gÿo gÿɛ́, te jʉ, te tÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ.
en: “Which ones? ” he asked him.

ngiemboon: ná mekùʼ tá gù, pɔ́ má gù, kwoŋo fɛ̌ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ páʼ ɔ̀ kwoŋo twó mbùm jú.»
en: honor your father and your mother; and love your neighbor as yourself.   ,# 19:19 Ex 20:12; Lv 19:18; Dt 5:16; Mt 5:43; 22:39; Gl 5:14; Jms 2:8

ngiemboon: Múɔshùm ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «N gee ńké ńtsẅé ńkúʼte mbʉ̌ mɛ̂ kuʼté ntsèm, akɔ́ nyé ńzága wɔ́ɔn?»
en: “I have kept all these,”   the young man told him. “What do I still lack? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne faʼa lémege ńcʉ́me, ɔ̀ gʉa sẅiŋ shúm sie ɔ̀ gẅiin ntsèm, ńgab nkáb mbwó patèmmó, ńdeen ńké ńdáʼ ńgẅiin shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ tÿǒ lepwó. Gʉa ńgÿo púʼu, ḿbiŋ ńtó, ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.»
en: “If you want to be perfect,”    Jesus said to him, “go, sell your belongings and give to the poor,   # 19:21 Lk 12:33; 16:9; Ac 2:45; 4:35; 1Tm 6:18 and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”

ngiemboon: Múɔshùm júʼu yɔɔn shwóŋè, eshÿó wé gwóon sẅɛ́ʼ, á tém nzèm ńgʉa, mélàʼmie à la gẅiin shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ tɛʼ.
en: When the young man heard that, he went away grieving, because he had many possessions.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwó ngàŋakwò yé ngie: «Mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́ ngie: Á tʉʉ mbwó ngàŋa mmó lékuu tsɛ̀ɛ lefùɔ Ssé.
en: Jesus said to his disciples, “Truly I tell you, it will be hard for a rich person to enter the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: N ge gíŋe ńnyɛte shwóŋo gẅí ngie, á zeŋe mbwó shÿɔ́ɔ léshúu tsɛ̀ɛ njwòŋ lesyɛʼɛ́, ńcʉa ngàŋa mmó lézẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ sáʼa yé.»
en: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”

ngiemboon: Engàŋakwò yé júʼu yɔɔn nò, á pú ńkʉʼʉ wɔ́b tɛʼ, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: «Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɛ́ʼɛ̀, mbà wɔ̌ ge láʼ tsẅɛ́?»
en: When the disciples heard this, they were utterly astonished and asked, “Then who can be saved? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô líe wɔ́b tà ńgɔɔn ngie: «Á cʉa pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, e Ssé kuʼu légÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.»
en: Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu Piɛ gɔɔn mbwó Yěsô ngie: «Tà peg leen ńnyé shúm ntsèm, ńcʉ́me nzèm gù páʼɔɔn, tà yég nò ge láʼ gwɔ́ lêkɔ́?»
en: Then Peter responded to him, “See, we have left everything and followed you. So what will there be for us? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́, mé ge láʼ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ sẅé, Míŋ Nyìŋ néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé gie á gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g, pi pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém pie pi la cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, gíŋe ńnéŋe gí na melʉŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém, ńŋag pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngẅɛ̀ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém.
en: Jesus said to them, “Truly I tell you, in the renewal of all things,    when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne,   # 19:28 Ps 45:6; Mt 25:31; Heb 1:8; Rv 3:21; 22:1,3 you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à la nyé mendá, ńnyé mefɛ̌ pé pembàŋa mbɔɔ pepanzwě, kà pɔ́ tá we, kà pɔ́ má we, kà pɔ́ penkʉ́ pé, kà pɔ́ menkáʼ mé wɔ́ɔ, ntí lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, à ge láʼ gíŋe gẅiin sɛ̌ shúm ngʉ̀a nkÿo, é gíŋe gẅiin legwɔ́ temì.
en: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother    or children or fields because of my name will receive a hundred times more and will inherit eternal life.   # 19:29 Mt 6:33; Mk 10:29; Lk 18:29

ngiemboon: Táʼ, lelÿò pagwɔ́ mvfò fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, é ge láʼ cʉ́ʼ pagwɔ́ nzèm, lelÿò pagwɔ́ nzèm fʉ̀ʼɔɔn e láʼ ńcʉ́ʼ pagwɔ́ mvfó.»
en: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.
